page.title: 05LIFE ON A FARM (II)
page.content: Life on a farm in the 1980's is a good life.It is a much easier life than it used to be;lorries collect the milk and make it into butter,instead of the wife having to churn it. In September & October the new seed is sown with a seed drill.Some land is not ploughed,it is sown directly into the soil. In November & December the cows are calving and any general repairs are done. January & February is the lambing season and is the busiest time of the year for sheep farmers. March & April,the spring seed is sown along with maize. In May & June,silage(pickled grass)is cut. July & August is the harvest time,when all farmers who grow crops work long hours.
